shortdesc.ph: Plays the specified audio effect in the channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int playEffectEx(RtcConnection connection, int soundId, String filePath, int loopCount, double pitch, double pan, double gain, boolean publish);

section.p: After preloading the audio effect using preloadEffect, you can call playEffectEx to play the specified audio effect to all users in the channel. Each call to this method can only play one audio effect. To play multiple audio effects simultaneously, use different soundId and filePath values and call this method multiple times.

ul.li: Agora recommends not playing more than three audio effects simultaneously.
The audio effect ID and file path in this method must match those used in preloadEffect.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method applies to multi-channel scenarios.

plentry.pd: The absolute path of a local file or the URL of an online file. Supported audio formats include mp3, mp4, m4a, aac, 3gp, mkv, and wav.

The number of times the audio effect loops:
-1: Loops indefinitely until or is called.
0: Plays once.
1: Plays twice.
The pitch of the audio effect. The range is from 0.5 to 2.0, with the default value being 1.0 (original pitch). The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

The spatial position of the audio effect. The range is from -1.0 to 1.0:
-1.0: The audio effect comes from the left of the user.
0.0: The audio effect comes from the front of the user.
1.0: The audio effect comes from the right of the user.
The volume of the audio effect. The range is from 0.0 to 100.0, with the default value being 100 (original volume). The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect in the channel:
: Publish the audio effect in the channel.
: Do not publish the audio effect in the channel.
